conclusion: The x/t-t graph shows the ratio of position to time as a function of time.
The slope of the graph represents the velocity of the car.
At t = 0, the value of x/t is 10 m/s, indicating the velocity at the start is 10 m/s.
The line in the x/t-t graph has a positive slope, indicating increasing velocity.
Acceleration is the rate of change of velocity with respect to time.
Since the slope is constant, velocity changes uniformly, allowing calculation of acceleration from the slope.
Calculate the slope using points (0, 10) and (2, 0) to find acceleration.
Slope calculation gives -5 m/s², representing the car's acceleration.
The car's acceleration from the start of timing is -5 m/s².
